description: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. From the Pampas to the peaks of the Andes they’ll find endless culinary inspiration to bring back home to Canada.
title: Opening Argentina

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.
title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

title: Incredible Homes

title: Crazy Rich Agents

title: MASH

description: This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.
title: For The Love Of Bread

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.
title: Searching With Chef Sang

description: Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.
title: Billionaire Wonderland

description: Celebrate tastes of the true north with Opening Canada. description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: Among them are actors Jeffrey Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Melissa McCarthy, and Sterling K. Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Legendary fashion designers Diane von Furstenberg, Narciso Rodriguez, and Zac Posen. As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.
title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

description: The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.
title: Opening Spain

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.

description: 106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: 106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!
title: MASH

description: Lidia’s Italy in America brings viewers on a road trip into the heart of Italian‐American cooking. Lidia Bastianich goes across the US to talk with fishermen, chefs, farmers, butchers, families, and entrepreneurs to learn more about the rich and diverse development of Italian‐American culture.
title: Lidia's Italy In America

description: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.
title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

description: Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.
title: Neven's Italian Food Trails

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.
title: Gino's Italian Escape

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.
title: Opening Spain

description: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.
title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

description: Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.
title: Opening Italy

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. description: Relive the goals and highlights from the previous round of Serie A in this 30 minute recap show.
title: Serie A: Full Impact

description: Find out what is to come in the upcoming round of Serie A in this 30 minute preview show.
title: Inside Serie A

description: TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Homemade

description: This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.
title: Searching With Chef Sang

description: The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.
title: Opening Sicily

description: Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.
title: Open Fire

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.
title: Gino's Italian Escape

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.
title: For The Love Of Bread

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.

description: Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.
title: Silvia's Italian Table

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.

Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.
title: Gino's Italian Escape

description: In Silvia’s Italian Masterclass we are offered an intimate insight into Silvia’s kitchen, who loves nothing more than to share what she has learnt along the way, so that you too can muster the beauty of simple, Italian homecooking.
title: Silvia’s Italian Masterclass

description: 106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!
title: MASH

description: The film highlights the two sides of Frida Kahlo’s spirit: on one side the revolutionary, pioneering artist of contemporary feminism and on the other, the human being, victim of her tortured body and a tormented relationship. With Asia Argento as narrator, the two faces of the artist will be revealed, by pursuing a common thread consisting of Frida’s own words: letters, diaries and private confessions. The film alternates interviews, with original documents, captivating reconstructions and Frida Kahlo’s own paintings, kept in some of the most amazing museums in Mexico.
title: Frida Viva La Vida

description: 106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!
title: MASH

description: This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.
title: For The Love Of Bread

description: This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.
title: Searching With Chef Sang

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.
title: Billionaire Wonderland

description: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.
title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

description: Six incredible cities, twelve emotive families and food cooked with a passion is the recipe for this year's fourth season of Tastes Like Home with Catherine Fulvio.
title: Tastes Like Home With Catherine Fulvio

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: Celebrate tastes of the true north with Opening Canada. Join celebrity chef duo Rob Rossi and Craig Harding as they eat their way across their home and native land making stops in The Laurentians, Montreal, Toronto, Saskatoon, the Blue Mountains, Whitehorse and Vancouver to celebrate Canada’s diverse food culture from coast to coast.
title: Opening Canada

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.
title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

description: This is a movie about moving melodies and lyrics composed by Dorinico, influenced and inspired by the songs brought by the Majorcans that emigrated to Cuba, which were taught to him by his grandfather. Hope, inspiration and power of the music will help Dorinico to live the experience of accomplishing a dream: to sing along with internationally renowned Cuban musicians and mix these songs with different music styles such as salsa, rumba, bolero…
title: Dorinico Living the Dream

description: Incredible Homes features Ireland’s most popular Television architect Dermot Bannon. In this series, Dermot visits some stunning and unusual homes across the Globe from London to Australia. On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.
title: Incredible Homes

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: Among them are actors Jeffrey Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Melissa McCarthy, and Sterling K. Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Legendary fashion designers Diane von Furstenberg, Narciso Rodriguez, and Zac Posen. As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.

description: The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.

And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.
title: Opening Italy

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.
title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

description: From its colonial-era origins in Montevideo's heart to its journey across continents, the documentary uncovers the parallels between Candombe's communication through rhythm and the Songs of the Underground Railroad used by enslaved individuals seeking freedom in Canada.
title: Candombe: Songs of Freedom

description: Savour the sights, sounds and flavours of the U.S.-Mexico border alongside acclaimed chef and James Beard Award-winning host Pati Jinich as she experiences the region’s rich culture, people and cuisine. Travel with Pati to El Paso, Ciudad Juárez, Laredo, Nuevo Laredo, McAllen and Brownsville as she shares meals with locals from all walks of life and reflects on the melding of cultures.
title: La Frontera With Pati Jinich

description: Four teenagers enter an online contest called “My Home Town” which tasks competitors to make a documentary about their town and what makes it special. Personville is a nice, quiet, small town, but all small towns have secrets.
title: The Hidden House

title: MASH

description: Four teenagers make a documentary on their hometown Personville. One of the oldest legends in the town is the mysterious “Hidden House” nestled deep in the woods, fenced off and guarded.
title: Personville

description: Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.
title: Cook, Eat, Burn

description: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.
title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

description: Australia’s home cook hero, Lyndey Milan, is a self-confessed Grecophile and is beyond excited to share her love of this wonderful country with her actor son, Blair Milan. Lyndey has organized to take Blair on a road trip through the Peloponnese to showcase firsthand all this captivating region has to offer.
title: Greece With My Son

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.
title: Opening Sicily

description: Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.
title: Open Fire

description: David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa

description: Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.
title: Neven's Italian Food Trails

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: This documentary delves deep into the heart of Día de Los Muertos. This revered Mexican tradition defies the conventional boundaries between life and death, encapsulating a profound connection between the living and the departed. With a rich exploration of its origins dating back to the Aztec civilization, the film navigates through the intricate layers of this cultural phenomenon, showcasing why it holds such paramount importance in Mexican heritage. As Día de Los Muertos finds its way into the cultural tapestry of Canada, the documentary unravels the intricate interplay between tradition and modernity and the transformative effects it exerts on local practices.
title: Dia De Los Muertos

description: Actors Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon embark on a six-part episodic road trip through Europe. This time they're in Spain, sampling the restaurants, eateries, and sights along the way.
title: The Trip To Spain

description: Hitman El Mariachi becomes involved in international espionage involving a psychotic CIA agent and a corrupt Mexican general.

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: The Opening Spain series has top Canadian Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding embarking on their next epic cooking adventure – this time traveling to Spain. The mecca for tapas, wine and ancient food culture, Spain has long fascinated the Chef’s. The ultimate destination for culinary inspiration with some of the best food and wine in the world, both Chefs can’t wait to explore its rich cultural history as they seek to bring back cooking knowledge and new technique to their successful new restaurants in Toronto.
title: Opening Spain

description: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.
title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

description: Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.
title: Crazy Rich Agents

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: Find out what is to come in the upcoming round of Serie A in this 30 minute preview show.
title: Inside Serie A

description: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.
title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

description: Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.
title: Billionaire Wonderland

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: Hitman El Mariachi becomes involved in international espionage involving a psychotic CIA agent and a corrupt Mexican general.
title: Once Upon A Time In Mexico

description: Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.
title: Silvia's Italian Table

description: TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Homemade

description: The new season of The Chef’s Bar is a celebration of Canada’s incredible food diversity and a chance for viewers to taste the true north! Featuring food inspired from eight provinces and two territories. It will give viewers an epic front row seat into incredibly mouth watering dishes featuring all Canadian ingredients
title: The Chef's Bar

description: Incredible Homes features Ireland’s most popular Television architect Dermot Bannon. In this series, Dermot visits some stunning and unusual homes across the Globe from London to Australia. On his busman’s holiday, Dermot meets homeowners, architects and realtors who show him award-winning homes and introduce him to some incredible living spaces and experiences.
title: Incredible Homes

description: TLN celebrity chef David Rocco welcomes viewers into his home kitchen in the newest installment of the Dolce series on TLN TV. “Dolce Homemade,” showcases David celebrating multicultural Canada by connecting with friends and family through candid conversations and inspiring recipes. Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Homemade

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: This story will take you on a journey around the planet, to discover the personalities and places behind the different types of bread eaten by people the world over. Every country has its own flavour, shaped by the local produce, culture, history and bakers that spend their lives making what for many, is a foundation of their diets.
title: For The Love Of Bread

description: Hollywood actor Ray Winstone takes a trip around Sicily with some old friends, soaking up the island's multicultural history, ancient culture and colourful inhabitants. His Grand Tour explores all the island has to offer - from the top of Mount Etna, to the palace of a Duchess in Palermo, to Agrigento's Valley of the Temples, and more!
title: Ray Winstone’s Sicily

description: Follow 7 rookie estate agents as they put everything on the line to sell some of the most impressive and exclusive properties in the UK - from Scottish castles to penthouse apartments, seaside mansions to gated estates.
title: Crazy Rich Agents

description: In Silvia’s Italian Masterclass we are offered an intimate insight into Silvia’s kitchen, who loves nothing more than to share what she has learnt along the way, so that you too can muster the beauty of simple, Italian homecooking.
title: Silvia’s Italian Masterclass

description: In 1980s Turin, scholarly high-schooler Vince, the son of a worker and a homemaker, has always been in love with his classmate Cate.
title: Nessuno Come Noi

description: The fabled Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar (a.k.a. El Cid) overcomes a family vendetta and court intrigue to defend Christian Spain against the Moors.
title: El Cid

description: Among them are actors Jeffrey Wright, Sigourney Weaver, Melissa McCarthy, and Sterling K. Brown, ground-breaking director Jordan Peele, Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi, acclaimed journalists Gayle King and Norah O’Donnell, musicians Queen Latifah and Jon Batiste. Legendary fashion designers Diane von Furstenberg, Narciso Rodriguez, and Zac Posen. As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.
title: Finding Your Roots

description: Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.
title: Cook, Eat, Burn

description: A Taste of Travel is a 13-part series that explores exciting destinations around the world. Hosts Carolyne, Lynton, Scott and Susannah head to South Africa, Thailand, Japan, Vietnam, Singapore, India, Fiji, Greece, Italy, France, and the USA and offer plenty of handy travel tips and insights into the colourful local characters, the great attractions and, of course, where to eat and what to eat!
title: A Taste Of Travel

description: Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. From realtors in Barbados to financiers in NYC and superyacht captains on the Cote d’Azur, Yasmine finds out what keeps the billionaires happy, and samples some of the lifestyle – for a few minutes at least.
title: Billionaire Wonderland

description: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. From the Pampas to the peaks of the Andes they’ll find endless culinary inspiration to bring back home to Canada.
title: Opening Argentina

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.
title: In The Kitchen With Stefano Faita

Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!
title: MASH

description: Hollywood actor Ray Winstone takes a trip around Sicily with some old friends, soaking up the island's multicultural history, ancient culture and colourful inhabitants. His Grand Tour explores all the island has to offer - from the top of Mount Etna, to the palace of a Duchess in Palermo, to Agrigento's Valley of the Temples, and more!
title: Ray Winstone’s Sicily

description: Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.
title: Silvia's Italian Table

description: Silvia handles the pot with her incredible Italian classics while Marion’s on the wok dishing up her Asian and Thai favourites. A new, unique 3 part cooking series arming each chef with their culinary pan of choice and fresh, fragrant produce.
title: Wok vs Pot With Silvia Colloca

description: Join Diane as she travels throughout Greece and its islands, where she explores many of the foods that Greece is known for (olive oil, feta, honey, yogurt and more), and discovers the country's traditions. Then watch Diane create simple home-cooked meals using the featured ingredients in each episode, and learn her tips on how to cook and pair them in a traditional Greek meal.
title: My Greek Table With Diane Kochilas

description: Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.
title: Cook, Eat, Burn

description: Australia’s home cook hero, Lyndey Milan, is a self-confessed Grecophile and is beyond excited to share her love of this wonderful country with her actor son, Blair Milan. Lyndey has organized to take Blair on a road trip through the Peloponnese to showcase firsthand all this captivating region has to offer.
title: Greece With My Son

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Join Italian travel expert Kathy McCabe, editor of the award-winning travel newsletter Dream of Italy, as she explores diverse regions of Italy. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.
title: Dream of Italy

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. He also explores the birthplaces of some of Italy’s most famous (and delicious) exports: gelato, balsamic vinegar and Parmigiano, only to discover that the food producers are just as interesting as the food itself.The series captures the way I Toscani celebrate life and live their very own Dolce Vita: with passion, humour and spontaneity.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Italia

description: The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. The ancient crossroads of the Mediterranean, this gorgeous island has a dazzling diversity of landscapes and cultural treasures. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.
title: Opening Sicily

description: Australia’s home cook hero, Lyndey Milan, is a self-confessed Grecophile and is beyond excited to share her love of this wonderful country with her actor son, Blair Milan. Lyndey has organized to take Blair on a road trip through the Peloponnese to showcase firsthand all this captivating region has to offer.
title: Greece With My Son

description: Open Fire is a rustic outdoor cooking series featuring acclaimed Chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding creating delicious, innovative dishes over multiple fires. The series spans all four seasons as the Chefs heat things up in the fresh days of spring through to the crisp cold of snowbound winter.
title: Open Fire

description: David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa

description: Visiting Abruzzo, Molise, Emilia Romagna, Il Veneto, Lombardia, Piemonte, Sardegna and Calabria, you will experience Italy’s most beautiful destinations in a way you have never seen before. Each episode will take you to a different part of the country to tell you all about its natural wonders, its diverse historical and artistic heritage and its ancient traditions.  Stunning aerial views and in-depth information give you the unique chance to visit Italy at its best.
title: Magnifica Italia

description: David experiences all that Tuscany has to offer: fishing the storied lagoons of Orbetello, braving the crowds at the Palio di Siena, celebrating the wheat harvest in the Tuscan countryside and even uncovering Florence’s small but vibrant Indian community. title: David Rocco's Dolce Vita

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.
title: Neven's Italian Food Trails

description: In Silvia’s Italian Masterclass we are offered an intimate insight into Silvia’s kitchen, who loves nothing more than to share what she has learnt along the way, so that you too can muster the beauty of simple, Italian homecooking.
title: Silvia’s Italian Masterclass

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: Gente da Nossa is a vibrant and engaging weekly Portuguese-language magazine-style show hosted by Nellie Pedro. Airing every Saturday morning on TLN TV, the program serves as a comprehensive and captivating window into the world of Portuguese culture, society, and current affairs captivating its audience by offering thought-provoking interviews with prominent figures in politics, religion, and business, alongside conversations with the most popular entertainers in Portugal. The show provides an insightful and diverse perspective on Portugal through weekly segments shot on location, offering viewers a firsthand look at various aspects of the country. Additionally, Gente da Nossa includes a community bulletin segment, informing audiences about upcoming events and activities happening within the local community.
title: Gente Da Nossa With Nellie Pedro

As well as a host of other luminaries, including Jeff Goldblum, Anjelica Huston, Isabella Rossellini, Terry Gross, Marc Maron, Eric Stonestreet, Issa Rae, Amy Ryan, and Justina Machado. Some of the guests whose stories we will revisit this season include actors Scarlett Johansson, Julianne Moore, and Marisa Tomei, journalist Lisa Ling, radio talk-show host Joe Madison, musician Questlove, and late-night comedian Jimmy Kimmel.
title: Finding Your Roots

description: Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.
title: Cook, Eat, Burn

description: Embark on the next chapter of the rustic adventures of young Canadian chef/owners Craig Harding and Rob Rossi as they head for the rugged countryside and towering mountain ranges of Argentina. description: Actor and comedian Yasmine Akram dives into the world of the seriously loaded by visiting billionaire playgrounds around the world – and meeting the wide range of people who run them. title: Billionaire Wonderland

description: Lidia’s Italy in America brings viewers on a road trip into the heart of Italian‐American cooking. Lidia Bastianich goes across the US to talk with fishermen, chefs, farmers, butchers, families, and entrepreneurs to learn more about the rich and diverse development of Italian‐American culture.
title: Lidia's Italy In America

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. He introduces us to the Portuguese influence in Goa, the Chinese community in Kolkata and the holiest of Punjabi traditions in Amritsar, and samples plenty of culinary delights along the way. Armed with his quanto basta or andaz (all by eye) approach to food, David cooks in kitchens across the country and breaks bread with the locals in hopes of demystifying Indian cuisine.
title: David Rocco's Dolce India

description: Opening Italy follows Canadian top chefs Rob Rossi and Craig Harding who recently fulfilled their life long dreams of building their own successful restaurants and now want to connect to their Italian roots by exploring the country and learning the basics of rustic Italian cooking to bring back into their own kitchens.
title: Opening Italy

description: David Rocco, the King of “Indi-talian” fusion returns to India to take the road less traveled, visiting lesser-known locales to uncover some of the country’s hidden gems in a new season of Dolce India. description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.

description: Lidia highlights Italian cooking that is effortless for everyone. This 26-part series showcases simple, easy-to-prepare recipes that require fewer steps, fewer ingredients, and less clean-up without sacrificing flavor.
title: Lidia's Kitchen

description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland. In this six part series, Neven tries a huge range of local produce, from grilled sardines, molasses and churros, to tuna heart, sherry, Iberico ham, Seville orange marmalade and Cordoba’s famous tomato soup. Neven also cooks a dish every week, inspired by the food he has discovered in each location
title: Neven's Spanish Food Trails

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. Defined by its sparse ingredients, proximity to the US border, and influences from Sephardic Jewish culinary roots, the flavors here are truly distinctive. And what Nuevo León lacks in ingredients, it makes up for with resourceful, creative people who are finding innovative ways to transform traditional flavors into familiar but exciting new experiences.
title: Pati's Mexican Table

description: If you don’t have the luxury of an Italian Nonna on speed dial, never fear! Leave it to Silvia Colloca, a food writer and home-cook with a passionate opinion on what true Italian food is, to take you by the hand to discover a new approach to everyday cooking. Silvia will guide you through the tantalising world of authentic Italian home-cooking with her trademark enthusiasm and flair.
title: Cook Like An Italian With Silvia Colloca

description: In this series, Gino is exploring the Mediterranean coast. He'll be immersing himself in the rugged wild islands, traveling along dramatic coastal roads, and across the sea, to reveal the best kept secrets of this coast.
title: Gino's Italian Escape

Featuring guests from around the world who share David’s passion for both food and life, the new series brings his adventurous spirit home.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Homemade

description: With its mesmerizing landscapes, rich artistic treasures, deep ties to the past and warm people, it is no wonder that travelers DREAM OF ITALY more than any other destination in the world. Meet Italy’s colorful locals — chefs, artisans, historians — who are deeply connected to their land, carrying on and preserving the traditions of their ancestors.

description: Amazing food and great conversation are served up in the new series Silvia's Italian Table featuring Australian actress, opera singer, author and chef Silvia Colloca. Joined by a diverse and eclectic group of celebrity guests including former Olympians Ian Thorpe, Duchess of York Sarah Ferguson, renowned journalist and presenter George Negus, acclaimed chef Matt Moran and actress Marta Dusseldorp,  Silvia shares her personal memories and inspiration behind each mouth-watering dish and visits some of the most stunning parts of Italy.
title: Silvia's Italian Table

description: This new TLN original documentary series follows celebrated chef and writer Sang Kim on a culinary road trip across his home province. Over the course of six half-hour episodes, Sang travels to meet a colourful, multi-generational cast of Korean Canadians, each with their own unique perspectives and recipes to share.
title: Searching With Chef Sang

title: Ray Winstone’s Sicily

description: David Rocco’s Dolce Africa tells the lesser-known stories of the world’s oldest continent. From ancient tribal villages and rural working farms, to breathtaking natural parks and big bustling cities, David explores the rich and diverse cultures and culinary worlds of Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Zanzibar and South Africa with curiosity, an open heart and an open mind. By fully immersing himself and the viewer in the sights, sounds and tastes of Africa, David shatters our preconceived notions of a continent that’s struggling to survive, and instead paints a picture of an Africa that is strong, proud and beautiful — the Africa of the future.
title: David Rocco's Dolce Africa

description: Australia’s home cook hero, Lyndey Milan, is a self-confessed Grecophile and is beyond excited to share her love of this wonderful country with her actor son, Blair Milan. Lyndey has organized to take Blair on a road trip through the Peloponnese to showcase firsthand all this captivating region has to offer.
title: Greece With My Son

description: The final chapter in the “Opening” series features Canadian chefs (and best friends) Rob Rossi and Craig Harding travelling to the island of Sicily for their next culinary adventure. It also boasts its very own style of traditional Italian cuisine and an increasingly vibrant wine scene.

description: Stefano inspires viewers with his passion for making food from scratch with fresh, simple ingredients. He shares his special rustic recipes inspired by his family’s rich food history and encourages viewers to get ‘in the kitchen’ to enjoy food with friends and family.

title: Silvia's Italian Table

description: 106 million people watched the timeless favorite M*A*S*H finale 35 years ago and no scripted show since has come close to beating the record. The hit sitcom about a U.S. medical team serving in the Korean War is back for another tour of duty on TLN and stars Italian American icon Alan Alda (Born Alphonso Joseph D’Abruzzo as Hawkeye Pierce. Relive all of your favourite MASH moments or see what all the hype is about and catch it for the first time from the beginning!
title: MASH

description: Lidia’s Italy in America brings viewers on a road trip into the heart of Italian‐American cooking. Lidia Bastianich goes across the US to talk with fishermen, chefs, farmers, butchers, families, and entrepreneurs to learn more about the rich and diverse development of Italian‐American culture.
title: Lidia's Italy In America

description: Donal Skehan shows viewers how to cook healthy, delicious recipes designed to help us get active, fuel fitness activities, and even embark on adventure sports.
title: Cook, Eat, Burn

description: Neven Maguire travels from Venice on the Adriatic Coast, to Sorrento on the Mediterranean, visiting Parma, Modena, Florence and Tuscany. Along the way, Ireland’s hugely popular chef learns about some of the wonderful food and drink that have made Italian cuisine so popular around the world, including parmesan cheese, pasta, Parma ham, Prosecco, olive oil, coffee and Chianti. Neven enjoys street food beside a race track, he is shown how to cook the perfect risotto by a Michelin star chef, and he is taught how to make the perfect cappuccino by Italy’s champion barista.
title: Neven's Italian Food Trails

description: On this season of Pati’s Mexican Table, Pati explores Nuevo León, a sprawling northeastern border state draped in dazzling mountains and miles of desert. description: Neven Maguire returns to Spain, and this time the popular chef is in Andalusia, a region in the south west of Spain that is larger than the island of Ireland.
